title: For Sale:  American Western Arms Longhorn in .357
postcontent: This is an American Western Arms Longhorn revolver in .357 caliber, with a 5.5" barrel. It has a blued finish and walnut grips. The gun is a replica of a Colt Single Action Army, and it is reported that the internals are Colt-compatible if you need replacement parts. The gun is in great condition. All bluing is intact and there are no scratches or wear marks that I can find. Although I bought it used, I don't think it saw very much use at all. I have put a few hundred rounds through it with no malfunctions. This style of gun sometimes has problems with light primer strikes. That doesn't seem to be an issue with this one, as I have had zero malfunctions in the time I've had it.

title: For Sale:  2880 rounds Wolf 124 gr. JHP and FMJ
postcontent:
Wolf 124 grain 7.62x39mm. Steel case. 1380 rounds are in 20-round packs. The rest (approximately 1500 rounds) is loose. Loose ammo was counted by weight, and rounded down to the nearest 100 to make sure you're getting a fair deal. Loose ammo is 99% FMJ, but there are a few JHP mixed in from boxes that I opened accidentally. 20-round packs are mixed JHP and FMJ--I have not taken them all out to count how many of each there are. Polymer dry-boxes are included at no additional charge.

This ammo sells for between $0.23 and $0.25 per round, plus shipping, in bulk quantity online. My price works out to $0.17 per round, and zero shipping. This ammo is as fresh as the day it was made, but since it's a private party sale, I'm well aware nobody is going to pay new-in-box prices. This will be a real steal to somebody who shoots a lot of 7.62x39.

I would prefer to sell this locally, to avoid you having to pay shipping on it, but I am willing to ship it wherever you like, as long as you're willing to pay the shipping :-)

title: For Sale:  1911 .45 ACP Military Match Pistol not Colt
postcontent:
This ia a Military Bullseye match pistol made by a Military armor to shoot competition. It is built to very tight tolerences, and is designed to shoot accurately out to 50 yards with nearly any type of ammo.
 As were most Unit match pistols, it was built from military parts, on an Essex frame.  The Essex frames were used because of their superior steel qualities ( over frames that were built in the 1940s ) , and the fact that the finished pistols could follow the Soldier to his next duty station, because the pistol belonged to him, rather than the US Government.
  The pistol has a WWII Remington Rand slide, GI National Match Barrel, National Match Bushing, Aluminum adjustable trigger, flattened and serrated mainspring housing, BO-MAR fully adjustable rear sight, National Match front sight, and a lightened GI Hammer and a Throated barrel . All of the pins are polished bright on the right side of the pistol ( this was about the only fancy cosmetic thing on these pistols ) .  It would cost over $1500 to have this work done on your pistol today....PLUS the pistol !  The bushing to  barrel, and slide to frame fit is very tight. Pistol is parkerized. These pistols were made to allow you to hit what you are aiming at !! Feel free to ask questions . No Calif sales. Face to face in OK. with OK drivers lisc. FFL required outside OK.

title: Want To Buy:  Deer Rifle
location: Saint Paul, Minneapolis / St. Paul, Minnesota
postcontent:
Ok, so...just found out I'll be hunting an area this fall with longer shots than I'm used to (long story involving the brother-in-law)....previous area hadn't really been anything over 100yds...and I usually hunted with an Enfield Mk4 or my Ruger 77/44 carbine. This fall, the shots will likely be in the 2-300yd range...so, rather than bubba up my Enfield to mount a scope, ask my 77/44 to do something its not comfortable with, or spend big bucks on a new rifle...I'm gonna beat the bushes here and see what arises. Doesn't have to be pretty, since I don't baby my hunting guns....but should be capable of holding its own accuracy-wise as long as I do my part, and be capable of having a scope mounted. 

I'm looking for something in .30-06 or .308 preferably, but would also take a sporterized 1917, 1903, Enfield or Mosin. I'm really not looking to spend a ton of dough, otherwise I'll just go new and put it on the card - which I would rather avoid. 

Lemme know what you've got - beaters/bubbas welcome! I have a PTC and am located in St. Paul. I'd be happy to travel nearly anywhere within reason, and/or host a test shoot out at Oakdale Gun Club.

title: For Sale:  U.S. WWI Colt Model 1911 -- .45 ACP Semi Auto Pistol, Mf'd 1914 - C&R OK
location: new York, New York, United States
postcontent:
LSB#: 120507SE01

Make: Colt

Model: 1911

Serial Number: 93700

Year of Manufacture: 1914

Caliber: .45 ACP

Action Type: Semi Auto, Magazine Fed

Markings: The left side of the slide is marked “Patented Apr. 20. 1897.Sept.9.1902 / Dec.19.1905.Feb.14.1911.Aug.1913”, and “Colt’s PT.F.A. Mfgt. Co. / Hartford, CT. U.S.A.”. and a rampant Colt no circle. The right side of the slide is marked “Model of 1911 U.S.Army”. The back of the slide is marked “H”, for Frank Hosmer. The left side of the frame is marked “United States Property”. Behind the trigger is the stamp for Walter G. Penfield (Jan 21911-Sept. 30, 1914) . The top of the receiver is marked “H” for Frank Hosmer, and “b”, for Jas Malloy. The markings on the frame and slide are correct. The barrel has markings “Colt 45 Auto”, and “P” on the lug. These barrel markings are for pistols from serial number 710,000- 1945.

Barrel Length: 5”

Sights / Optics: This pistol is mounted with standard military sights. A blade front sight and a notch in a dovetail rear sight.

Stock Configuration & Condition: The grips are correct diamond pattern checkered wood. The checkering has become smooth. There are compression marks and wear on both panels and some smoothing/rounding at the bottoms but there are no chips cracks or losses. The grips rate in about Good overall condition.

Type of Finish: Blue

Finish Originality: The finish is likely an old re-blue. There is some pitting under the blue on the top of the slide.

Bore Condition: The bore is a little gray and the rifling is sharp and deep. There is mild erosion in the flats. The bore is very shootable.

Overall Condition: This pistol retains about 40% of its metal finish. The entire surface has become mottled with mixed patches of blue and wear down to the brown colored metal. There are a few patches of surface rust, on both sides of the frame above and around the trigger guard, and on the right side at the hammer. There is a small amount of surface rust on the left front of the slide and above the ejection port. The barrel shows wear and finish loss on the top surface at the lugs extending to the back of the barrel. The magazine shows its correct two tone finish with some pinprick erosion on the sides. There are some dings along the backstrap. The Screw heads are sharp and not disfigured. The markings are clear. Overall, this gun rates in about Good condition especially for its age.

Mechanics: The action functions correctly. We have had this pistol apart several times and it is functionally correct. We did not fire this pistol.

Box, Paperwork & Accessories: One correct two tone magazine with lanyard ring is provided.

Our Assessment: This is a correct 1914 U.S. marked Colt 1911 except for the barrel. The grips, frame, inspector marks, magazine, all correctly check out, only the barrel is not original manufacture. However, the barrel is correct Colt from serial number 710,000 all the way to 1945. So this is still be an all “U.S.” pistol.

title: For Sale:  Pre ban Polytech AK47 with extras/LOWERED PRICE
postcontent: I paid $1,500 at a gunshow last year but between working alot and buying a house i dont shoot anymore. Im selling my ak47 rifle thats is a preban polytech imported from china and made USA compliant in arizona as marked on the rifle in the picture. The barrell is threaded which is nice you have alot of options of what you can do to it but i have kept the A2 birdcage muzzle on it unchanged since i bought it, i will also be throwing in for a deal the ak47 trident 3 tipped muzzle break ($40) with it that i later bought but didnt put on. The stock is a double steel underfolder which makes it all the more fun to shoot. In the front is the bayonette lug with bayonet which is also an underfolder. I personally liked the bipod attached to it when i shot it as seen in the pic but these semi auto rifles dont need a bipod i just thought it looked badass. I will throw in 3 steel ribbed 30 round preban magazines in mint condition ( and ammo for them) and if the buyer wants more i have 1 more 30 round mag and 1 40 round preban NYS complaint magazine thats black steel ribbed that i will sell seperately. I also have a stash of brown bear 143 grain ammo for it for the taking at a dirt cheap price, just ask if you want the extras. This is smooth, powerfull, accurate and most importantly has never jammed with the 400 rounds i have put threw it at the fish and game club. For a 1987 preban this true ak47 rifle is more reliable than these new guns stores are selling and i really really hate to sell it and i dont want to lose even a dollar on a rare gun like this but the house is more important right now. Serious buyers only please, I would consider trading for a newer springfield m14/m1a with black fiberglass stock, not preban wooden stock, i want newer. this wont last long. Make an offer. Thanks

title: For Sale:  Arsenal Arms SA M7-SF
postcontent:
This is an Arsenal arms SA M7-SF. It is an AK pattern rifle, chambered in 7.62x39mm. It has a milled receiver and a skeleton, side-folding stock. Arsenal is American importer and manufacturer of Bulgarian AKs. These are, hands-down, the best AKs you can buy in America.

Arsenal has stopped making milled receiver side-folders, so the value of these guns has increased in recent years. NIB examples regularly sell for around $1500. This gun has right around 1000 ounds through it, so it's certainly not NIB, but 1000 rounds in the life of an AK is nothing to speak of. If you're concerned, I'll give you $30 for a new recoil spring!

EDIT: The ad previously indicated the gun had "no more than 2000" rounds through it. I found the receipts in my email for the bulk purchases of ammo that I made when I first bought the gun, and was able to subtract out how many I had left to determine a more accurate round count. That is why the round count has gone down.

The gun has a receiver-mounted scope rail and a cheap Bushnell red dot sight (resale value: $0) that I'm including. I also have a five-round magazine that I will throw in for free, in case you want to take the gun deer hunting or something else where there is a magazine restriction.

EDIT: The 30-round magazines that I had previously described have sold separately and are no longer part of the sale.

The site will only let me put up three pictures, so I have one overall view, and then the remaining two, I have focused on the two areas where there is wear on the gun, so you can assess its condition accurately. title: For Sale:  Gibson Les Paul Jr. Billie Joe Armstrong of Greenday Signature Guitar
postcontent:
For sale or Trade: Billie Joe Armstrong Les Paul Jr. : Gibson introduces the Billie Joe Armstrong Les Paul Junior. Designed in close cooperation with Billie Joe, the signature guitar is modeled closely after "Floyd," Billie Joe's original 1956 Les Paul Junior. With a mahogany body and neck and nickel hardware, the Billie Joe Armstrong Les Paul Junior combines the best features of a vintage Junior with some modern twists. With a special design double-coil P-90 and a vintage correct non-compensated wraparound bridge, the Billie Joe Armstrong is a ferocious, resonant rock 'n' roll guitar, truly worthy of Billie Joe's name. 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JjhO3VGfpFk&feature=related

Since emerging from the close-knit punk scene of California's East Bay in the early 1990s, Green Day have evolved into one of the most popular and creatively ambitious rock 'n' roll bands of all time. Frontman Billie Joe Armstrong - drawing on the buzz saw guitar of the Ramones and Husker Du and the raw poetics of the Replacements' Paul Westerberg - has evolved over the years into a fiercely distinctive guitarist and songwriter. Combining melodic chord voicing with a blistering, jackhammer rhythm, Armstrong's playing deftly underscores the mood and theme of his songs. Buoyed by one of rock's truly great rhythm sections-bassist Mike Dirnt and drummer Tre Cool-Armstrong has proven just how much can be accomplished with one guitar, bass, and drums. From the swinging dynamics of the band's 1994 breakthrough hit "Longview" to the staggering Who-like sprawl of 2004's amazing American Idiot, Green Day have honored the traditions of their influences while taking stripped-down rock 'n' roll to dizzying creative heights.

In 1992 Colt modified almost their entire catalog of 1911 pistols to include features that they felt would update their product line in the face of the increasingly popular factory-custom 1911 market. The changes were:

title: For Sale:  Remington & Mossberg Shotgun Tactical Rail 500/590/590A1
postcontent:
*****Please visit us at  LiveFireArmory.com for more information*****

                      For Remington 870 and Mossberg 500/590/590A1

Priced at $145.00+4.9%=$152.11OTD

Product Description

So far as we can tell, this is the first manufactured Mossberg 500/590 quad rail produced and what a great piece! This Mossberg rail is the last word in quality accessorizing.


Prepare to be blown away, because this is the real deal. As you can see by the pics, the piece is beautiful and entirely functional. The piece now allows any accessory that can fit on a rifle to now be mounted on the Mossberg 500/590. Even the 590A1! The RB7M quad rail system features:


One piece T6 6061 construction
Small 14 ounce weight!!
Type 2 black anodizing
Full install kit with tools

Serial number remains visible! In many states it's a crime to obscure the serial number of any firearm, and our rails do not obscure the serial numbers whatsoever!

Normal retail is a whopping $269-$359 on rails that are far heavier and are of less quality!!

Mossberg 590A1 pictured is not for sale, but we can duplicat. Contact us for details.


____________________________________________________________


Here's the best part. These items are made in America! We support American companies and American workers!!!


No gunsmitthing required! This rail will fit both tapped and untapped receivers, both. Install time take under 10 minutes from the time the rail is removed from the box to the time the shotgun is ready to fire. We even supply the tools and instructions! Bayonet lugs on the 590A1 should be lightly narrowed for the best fit. Oem heat shields should be removed as our rail replaces it. 20" barrel is shown. We recommend an 18" minimum barrel length. Works with both shorter and extended mags!


*** A side note. The clamp system in this kit sees 100% of the shock associated with every round fired. It is of the utmost importance that the clamp be as tight as possible so as not to move backwards. Loctite and frequent checking of the clamps is recommended. If the clamp works loose, all of the energy is transferred to the pins and screws, which are not meant to see that level of shock. ***

title: For Sale/Trade:  1950's - 60's Brazilian INA revolver
postcontent:
Hello, I have an old fashioned 5 shot revolver for trade for a semi-auto pistol. It's a .38 special with a 3 and 1/4 inch barrel. I've taken the time to look up the history on this handgun and have learned that it was a standard police issue INA revolver. Well it doesn't really specify on the gun the name however it has a tiger stamp on the frame. 

Here is a youtube video that explains this firearm in detail:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jHFlJ3x1X_c 

Anyhow, it's a single/double action 5 shot .38 Special. It still fires excellent as I have fired it many times and shows great accuracy for a revolver. It does have a few rust patches here and there for it being 50+ years old, however, none that are in the barrel or the cylinder. All exterior.

I'm honestly not much of a revolver fan. It's good to have around the house but I would much rather have a semi-auto pistol. I'm looking for trade more than sell. I'm looking to trade for a pocket sized (ankle holster) .380. However, I may be open to other calibers. Please be reasonable about your trade. Willing to meet in person.

The revolver also comes with a box of lead point rounds AND a box of Hornady Critical Defense hollow points (non +P)

Email for best response. However you may text. Please do not call.
wentz.jasonp85 at gmail
  REDACTED
